content:
Diagnosis:	Squamous cell carcinoma of larynx, T3N0M0

Management:	15 Jan 2024 - Commenced definitive chemoradiotherapy
		70Gy in 35 fractions with concurrent weekly cisplatin

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, p16 negative

Current Situation:	Week 5 of treatment, requiring admission for toxicity

I reviewed [redacted name] today following recent admission for grade 3 mucositis and grade 2 acute kidney injury. His creatinine clearance has dropped to 45ml/min from a baseline of 85ml/min. He has completed 5 cycles of weekly cisplatin but given the significant toxicity, we will omit the final cycle. His radiotherapy has continued uninterrupted and he has completed 25 of 35 fractions.

He is managing to maintain oral intake with liquid nutrition supplements, though requires regular breakthrough morphine for pain. His weight has dropped by 4kg since starting treatment. We have arranged intensive supportive care with twice-weekly reviews in the combined radiotherapy clinic. I have prescribed additional anti-emetics and arranged urgent dietitian review.

The plan is to complete the remaining radiotherapy fractions with enhanced supportive care but without further cisplatin. We will see him again next week. I have informed the acute oncology team about his situation should he require weekend review.
